medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began suddenly with right arm pain and numbness after waking up. Over the following weeks, the pain worsened, leading to dropping items and increased difficulty with writing, buttoning clothing, and opening jars. He received modest pain relief from opioids, but physical therapy and an epidural steroid injection did not prevent the progression to near-paralysis of the right wrist and fingers. Two weeks post-surgery for cervical discectomy, he developed weakness in the right shoulder and increased tingling in the right hand, along with new symptoms in the left hand.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ten years prior to presentation, the patient experienced left hand numbness and weakness with shoulder pain that resolved completely. The patient's family history includes similar episodes of wrist drop in his brother and recurring numbness in his sister.
medical_history.family_history: His brother had multiple episodes of wrist drop since age 7, and his sister also wore a wrist brace. His maternal grandfather had episodes of transient foot drop. His daughter had similar symptoms of numbness and pain in her right arm lasting 3 months and resolving completely.
